title: rounded font ID
content:
Can someone please help me identify this nice rounded font.  
Many thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/test_6257.jpg)

 [‹ Type ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50884 "Go to previous forum topic") [font used on ww.wolffolins.com ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50966 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Marco

comments.content:
Hi Marco,

I think it is [Gravostyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.optimo.ch/).

More rounded industrial linéales with a single-storey ‘a’:  
 [DIN 17](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=din+17&x=0&y=0&sample_text=het%20Ramadan%20Festival)  
 [Omnes](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.dardenstudio.com/typefaces/omnes-features)  
 [Simpliciter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larstornqvist/simpliciter-sans/bold/)  
 [Typ 1451](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/Bold/)  
 [VAG](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111926/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=vag)

F

Thanks Florian,

I confused it with Gravur condensed,

M
